questions.question: What is the chemical stability of BUT-8(Cr)A in different acidic/basic aqueous solutions?
questions.answer: BUT-8(Cr)A was intact in aqueous solutions with a wide pH value range, even in 10 M sulfuric acid or concentrated hydrochloric acid for one week.

questions.question: How does the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A compare to that of MIL-101-SO3H at 65% RH?
questions.answer: The proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A at 65% RH is significantly higher than that of MIL-101-SO3H.

questions.question: What role do sulfonic acid sites play in the proton conduction of BUT-8(Cr)A?
questions.answer: The high density of sulfonic acid sites in BUT-8(Cr)A facilitates proton conduction by providing proton donors and participating in hydrogen-bonding networks.

questions.question: Is the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A at 100% RH and 80°C higher than that of Nafion?
questions.answer: The proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A at 100% RH and 80°C is comparable to that of Nafion.

questions.question: Does the structural flexibility of BUT-8(Cr)A contribute to its high proton conductivity?
questions.answer: Yes, the structural flexibility of BUT-8(Cr)A allows it to self-adapt its framework under different humid environments, ensuring smooth proton conduction pathways.

questions.question: True or False: BUT-8(Cr)A demonstrates higher proton conductivity at low relative humidity compared to other MOFs.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the impact of water content on the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A?
questions.answer: The increase in water content with increased RH enhances the proton conductivities of BUT-8(Cr)A, implying that protons primarily migrate through the inner pores of the MOFs.

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivities of BUT-8(Cr)A and BUT-8(Cr) cannot be linearly correlated with the water content in the RH range of 11~65%.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: How does the chemical stability of BUT-8(Cr)A compare to BUT-8(Al) in aqueous solution?
questions.answer: BUT-8(Cr)A shows significantly better chemical stability in aqueous solution compared to BUT-8(Al), which shows a much weaker and unidentifiable PXRD pattern after being immersed in water.

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A is attributed solely to its hydrophilic pores.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What experimental technique was used to measure the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A?
questions.answer: Alternating current (a.c.) impedance was used to measure the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A.

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivities of BUT-8(Cr)A and BUT-8(Cr) are higher than most reported proton-conducting MOFs at 65% RH.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the role of water molecules in the structural flexibility of BUT-8(Cr)A?
questions.answer: Water molecules are absorbed into the pores of BUT-8(Cr)A, leading to structural expansion and flexibility, which is attributed to the water adsorption under different RHs.

questions.question: True or False: The structural transformation of BUT-8(Cr)A is slow and irreversible.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: How does the proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A change with temperature at 100% RH?
questions.answer: The proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A increases with temperature at 100% RH, reaching up to 1.27 × 10−1 S cm−1 at 80 °C.

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivities of BUT-8(Cr)A and BUT-8(Cr) are significantly higher at a much lower RH of 11% compared to MIL-101-SO3H.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What mechanism is proposed for the unique water-content-dependent proton conduction of BUT-8(Cr)A?
questions.answer: The unique water-content-dependent proton conduction of BUT-8(Cr)A could be attributed to the self-adaption of its frameworks to ensure proton transportation even at a comparatively low RH.

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivities of BUT-8(Cr)A and BUT-8(Cr) can be linearly correlated with the water content in the RH range of 11~65%.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the activation energy for proton conduction in BUT-8(Cr)A?
questions.answer: The evaluated activation energy (Ea) of BUT-8(Cr)A is 0.11 eV.

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivity of BUT-8(Cr)A at 80 °C and 100% RH is the highest reported among the explored MOFs.
questions.answer: True
